info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 4:16AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Buck Creek at Acton.
Mill Creek near Cataract.
Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
.Additional widespread heavy rainfall Friday night has led to Minor to Moderate Flooding on several streams and creeks across central Indiana. Flooding will crest on most creeks later today and recede through minor flood later this weekend.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mill Creek near Cataract.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Extensive flooding along Mill Creek. Camp Otto, Owen Park and possibly other local roads flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 AM EDT Saturday was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.5 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 730 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
